first_reading.text:
[[Is 66,10]]Thus says the LORD: Rejoice with Jerusalem and be glad because of her, all you who love her; Exult, exult with her, all you who were mourning over her!
[[Is 66,11]]Oh, that you may suck fully of the milk of her comfort, That you may nurse with delight at her abundant breasts!
[[Is 66,12]]For thus says the LORD: Lo, I will spread prosperity over her like a river, and the wealth of the nations like an overflowing torrent. As nurslings, you shall be carried in her arms, and fondled in her lap;
[[Is 66,13]]As a mother comforts her son, so will I comfort you; in Jerusalem you shall find your comfort.
[[Is 66,14]]When you see this, your heart shall rejoice, and your bodies flourish like the grass; The LORD'S power shall be known to his servants.
first_reading.title: Book of Isaiah

psalm.text:
[[Ps 66,1]]Shout joyfully to God, all the earth,
[[Ps 66,2]]sing praise to the glory of his name; 
proclaim his glorious praise.
[[Ps 66,3]]Say to God, “How tremendous are your deeds!”

[[Ps 66,4]]“Let all on earth worship and sing praise to you, 
sing praise to your name!”
[[Ps 66,5]]Come and see the works of God, 
his tremendous deeds among the children of Adam.

[[Ps 66,6]]He has changed the sea into dry land; 
through the river they passed on foot; 
therefore let us rejoice in him.
[[Ps 66,7]]He rules by his might forever.

[[Ps 66,16]]Hear now, all you who fear God, while I declare 
what he has done for me.
[[Ps 66,20]]Blessed be God who refused me not 
my prayer or his kindness!
psalm.title: Psalms

gospel.text:
[[Lc 10,1]]The Lord Jesus appointed seventy-two others whom he sent ahead of him in pairs to every town and place he intended to visit.
[[Lc 10,2]]He said to them, "The harvest is abundant but the laborers are few; so ask the master of the harvest to send out laborers for his harvest.
[[Lc 10,3]]Go on your way; behold, I am sending you like lambs among wolves.
[[Lc 10,4]]Carry no money bag, no sack, no sandals; and greet no one along the way.
[[Lc 10,5]]Into whatever house you enter, first say, 'Peace to this household.'
[[Lc 10,6]]If a peaceful person lives there, your peace will rest on him; but if not, it will return to you.
[[Lc 10,7]]Stay in the same house and eat and drink what is offered to you, for the laborer deserves his payment. Do not move about from one house to another.
[[Lc 10,8]]Whatever town you enter and they welcome you, eat what is set before you,
[[Lc 10,9]]cure the sick in it and say to them, 'The kingdom of God is at hand for you.'"
[[Lc 10,10]]Whatever town you enter and they do not receive you, go out into the streets and say,
[[Lc 10,11]]'The dust of your town that clings to our feet, even that we shake off against you.' Yet know this: the kingdom of God is at hand.
[[Lc 10,12]]I tell you, it will be more tolerable for Sodom on that day than for that town.
[[Lc 10,17]]The seventy (-two) returned rejoicing, and said, "Lord, even the demons are subject to us because of your name."
[[Lc 10,18]]Jesus said, "I have observed Satan fall like lightning from the sky.
[[Lc 10,19]]Behold, I have given you the power 'to tread upon serpents' and scorpions and upon the full force of the enemy and nothing will harm you.
[[Lc 10,20]]Nevertheless, do not rejoice because the spirits are subject to you, but rejoice because your names are written in heaven."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke

second_reading.text:
[[Ga 6,14]]Brothers and sisters: may I never boast except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through which the world has been crucified to me, and I to the world.
[[Ga 6,15]]For neither does circumcision mean anything, nor does uncircumcision, but only a new creation.
[[Ga 6,16]]Peace and mercy be to all who follow this rule and to the Israel of God.
[[Ga 6,17]]From now on, let no one make troubles for me; for I bear the marks of Jesus on my body.
[[Ga 6,18]]The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit, brothers and sisters. Amen.
second_reading.title: Letter to the Galatians
